review: Love it, ordered it with subscription to Sling tv.  All we watch is prime tv, netflix.  My hub watches ESPN 2 for fishing and I like AMC for walking dead so this suited our needs :)  I may check out better call saul too.  Sling also has abc family and we like modern family so that is cool as wel!!!!!  It has adult swim and cartoon network which shows some popular cartoons and such for the teenagers.I digress.  Anyway we hooked it up without issue to our Sony Bravia television and the picture was stunning!  I was also able to connect through the kindle fire stick app on my 2012 kindle hd tablet and download the app to my android cell phone and connect and use the "fling" feature through there.  This made the fire stick even EASIER to use because it come with a keyboard function.You can download several apps and games as well and probably even shop on there too I am geussing if you wanted :)great purchase.  For 20 bucks a month sling gave us a great alternative to cable.  I pay $80 a month for the highest/fastest internet I can get as I have a family of computer/gamers.  So for around 100 a month I know have a little television and internet.  I find this is still less than many popular "bundled" packages.As a prime member I also have access to lots of free content on amazon and the option to rent current content on family nights, which is almost like the "on demand" option through cable, I feel as though I am missing nothing????What a hit!  Thanks amazon!!!!!!!!

review: The Fire TV stick repeatedly disconnects from wifi, I don't think I've ever had more than 30 minutes of uptime.  I preordered in Oct and received in Dec.  After initial set up I was so annoyed that I never used it again and forgot about it.  I  still has access to Prime on the Roku so it wasn't a large issue. Recently I remembered it and tried it again, but on multiple networks it had the same connection problems. It says strong connection but it isn't connected; only unplugging it briefly seems to fix it.This is a very common complaint and it pretty much renders the device useless.  Restarting the stick does temporarily fix it but that is not something I should have to do frequently.  I'm an early adopter so this kind of snafu is always a risk, but I didn't expect it from a major player like Amazon.I'm really glad I preordered for only $20.  I don't know if I can get a return at this point.On the plus side I appreciate my Roku that much more now.If you are considering the Fire TV stick wait to see if a fixed product is released, then wait again to see if it actually works.
